edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain

Class HeadingableTankDrivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.Drivetrain
      • edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.TankDrivetrain
        • edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.HeadingableTankDrivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Headingable, Positionable, Rotatable

    public class HeadingableTankDrivetrain
extends TankDrivetrain
implements Headingable
    Created by Michaela on 2018-1-2. A Tank Drivetrain with some sort of heading sensor, such as a gyro. Uses the sensor and a controller specified by the user to control the system.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finishRotating()
      Empty — we don't change any setting that needs to be changed back
      double getCurrentHeading()
      Get the current heading of the drivetrain (presumably a value from a sensor and not necessarily the drivetrain's target heading).

      Get the target heading of the drivetrain (not necessarily the actual, current heading of the drivetrain), passed in using setTargetHeading(double).
      boolean isRotating()
      Use this as a loop condition (with {@link #updateHeading in the loop body) if you want to turn to a specific heading and then move on to other code.

      Set the target heading of the drivetrain.

      • getTargetHeading

        public double getTargetHeading()
        Get the target heading of the drivetrain (not necessarily the actual, current heading of the drivetrain), passed in using setTargetHeading(double).
        Specified by:
        getTargetHeading in interface Headingable
        Returns:
        The heading that the robot is currently trying to get to or maintain

      • isRotating

        public boolean isRotating()
        Use this as a loop condition (with {@link #updateHeading in the loop body) if you want to turn to a specific heading and then move on to other code.
        Specified by:
        isRotating in interface Headingable
        Returns:
        Whether or not the drivetrain is still rotating towards the target heading
